items.title: How Micro-lessons Work
items.objective: Learn how missions, rewards, and attestations work across the Civic app.
content: Micro-lessons are short, verifiable tasks that teach you how to use the Civic app.
When you finish a mission you earn points (and sometimes a badge).
Your completion is recorded as an attestation (local now; chain later).

assessments.prompt: What do you earn for completing missions?

tasks.label: Open the Micro-lessons page from the sidebar

items.title: Dashboard Tour
items.objective: Understand the Civic dashboard layout and quick actions.
content: The Dashboard shows your recent activity, KPI tiles, and quick links.
Use the left rail to jump between Surveys, Elections, Proposals, and Treasury.

assessments.prompt: Name one thing you can check on the Dashboard.

tasks.label: Paste a link to a post you liked about civic engagement

items.title: Northstar Dashboard KPIs
items.objective: Learn how Northstar KPIs track impact and participation.
content: Northstar KPIs summarize participation and learning momentum.
Your micro-lesson completions increment KPI counters in real time.

tasks.label: Confirm you’re subscribed to our channel

items.title: Elections: Practice Voting
items.objective: See how mock elections, ballots, and results work.
content: Mock elections simulate ballots so you can practice evaluating options.
You’ll see proposals, candidate statements, and voting outcomes.

assessments.prompt: What’s one benefit of practicing with mock elections?

tasks.label: Share a link to a reliable civics resource you recommend

items.title: Proposals: Create & Debate
items.objective: Learn to submit, review, and vote on policy proposals.
content: Proposals let the community submit ideas, provide rationale, and budget impacts.
Debate and voting refine the best ideas into actionable items.

tasks.label: Paste a link to a post where you summarized a proposal in one sentence

items.title: Treasury Simulator
items.objective: Balance trade-offs by allocating a limited budget to programs.
content: The Treasury Simulator teaches constraints: choosing A often means not choosing B.
Experiment with sliders or allocations and note the downstream impact.

assessments.prompt: Describe one trade-off you noticed while rebalancing.

tasks.label: Share a post that explains your budget choice in 1–2 lines

items.title: Issue Survey
items.objective: Answer neutrally framed questions to map your Civic Profile.
content: The Issue Survey uses a Likert scale to map your positions across axes.
Aim for honesty; your profile improves as you answer more questions.

assessments.prompt: How many points are on the Likert scale here?

items.title: Reading Your Profile
items.objective: Interpret axes, quadrant placement, and confidence.
content: Your profile shows normalized axis values and a 2D placement.
Confidence rises as you answer more questions and complete missions.

assessments.prompt: What could you do to raise confidence in your profile reading?

tasks.label: Share a (non-political) learning insight you gained

items.title: Rewards Wallet
items.objective: View total points, badges, and recent attestations.
content: Your wallet shows points earned and badges collected from micro-lessons.
More missions = more points; some missions grant unique badges.

tasks.label: Paste a link to any SHF post you liked

items.title: Settings & Privacy
items.objective: Adjust preferences and understand what gets published.
content: Settings centralize your preferences and privacy choices.
We guard against publishing political content externally without approval.

assessments.prompt: Name one privacy safeguard mentioned in the app.
